segment.source: Edge-based animations show or hide UI that originates from the edge of the screen.
segment.target: Edge-based animations show or hide UI that originates from the edge of the screen.

segment.source: Edge-based UI animations in UWP apps
segment.target: Edge-based UI animations in UWP apps

segment.source: Edge-based UI animations
segment.target: Edge-based UI animations

segment.source: Edge-based animations show or hide UI that originates from the edge of the screen.
segment.target: Edge-based animations show or hide UI that originates from the edge of the screen.

segment.source: The show and hide actions can be initiated either by the user or by the app.
segment.target: The show and hide actions can be initiated either by the user or by the app.

segment.source: The UI can either overlay the app or be part of the main app surface.
segment.target: The UI can either overlay the app or be part of the main app surface.

segment.source: If the UI is part of the app surface, the rest of the app might need to be resized to accommodate it.
segment.target: If the UI is part of the app surface, the rest of the app might need to be resized to accommodate it.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: EdgeUIThemeTransition class
segment.target: EdgeUIThemeTransition class

segment.source: Do's and don'ts
segment.target: Do's and don'ts

segment.source: Use edge UI animations to show or hide a custom message or error bar that does not extend far into the screen.
segment.target: Use edge UI animations to show or hide a custom message or error bar that does not extend far into the screen.

segment.source: Use panel animations to show UI that slides a significant distance into the screen, such as a task pane or a custom soft keyboard.
segment.target: Use panel animations to show UI that slides a significant distance into the screen, such as a task pane or a custom soft keyboard.

segment.source: Slide the UI in from the same edge it will be attached to.
segment.target: Slide the UI in from the same edge it will be attached to.

segment.source: Slide the UI out to the same edge it came from.
segment.target: Slide the UI out to the same edge it came from.

segment.source: If the contents of the app need to resize in response to the UI sliding in or out, use fade animations for the resize.
segment.target: If the contents of the app need to resize in response to the UI sliding in or out, use fade animations for the resize.

segment.source: If the UI is sliding in, use a fade animation after the edge UI or panel animation.
segment.target: If the UI is sliding in, use a fade animation after the edge UI or panel animation.

segment.source: If the UI is sliding out, use a fade animation at the same time as the edge UI or panel animation.
segment.target: If the UI is sliding out, use a fade animation at the same time as the edge UI or panel animation.

segment.source: Don't apply these animations to notifications.
segment.target: Don't apply these animations to notifications.

segment.source: Notifications should not be housed within edge-based UI.
segment.target: Notifications should not be housed within edge-based UI.

segment.source: Don't apply the edge UI or panel animations to any UI container or control that is not at the edge of the screen.
segment.target: Don't apply the edge UI or panel animations to any UI container or control that is not at the edge of the screen.

segment.source: These animations are used only for showing, resizing, and dismissing UI at the edges of the screen.
segment.target: These animations are used only for showing, resizing, and dismissing UI at the edges of the screen.

segment.source: To move other types of UI, use reposition animations.
segment.target: To move other types of UI, use reposition animations.

segment.source: illustrates when to use edge ui or panel animations and when to use reposition.
segment.target: illustrates when to use edge ui or panel animations and when to use reposition.
